intro: Osteospermum bipinnatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pale blue petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Osteospermum bipinnatum thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
